title: Reps from DHS, the FBI and the ODNI met with tech companies at Facebook to talk election security
text: Representatives from the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence and the Department of Homeland Security met with counterparts at tech companies including Facebook, Google, Microsoft and Twitter to discuss election security, Facebook confirmed.

title: Facebook confirms 419m users’ phone numbers exposed in latest privacy lapse
text: The information was stored in an online server that was not password protected, according to a report from TechCrunch

title: Facebook users' phone numbers exposed online
text: A server contained hundreds of millions of phone numbers tied to Facebook accounts.

title: Sen. Wyden says Zuckerberg deserves potential jail time for privacy lapses
text: Fox News senior judicial analyst Judge Andrew Napolitano says Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg did not commit a criminal act by allowing privacy lapses at the social media company.

title: Facebook Is The Digital Singularity
text: Facebook has faced continuing concerns recently over public and government scrutiny that has resulted in shaky margins, earnings growth and guidance due to compliance and investment costs.

title: Facebook, Twitter, Google are meeting with US officials to discuss 2020 election security
text: U.S. tech companies on Wednesday met with various U.S. government agencies to discuss their preparation for the 2020 presidential election.

title: A huge database of Facebook users’ phone numbers found online
text: Hundreds of millions of phone numbers linked to Facebook accounts have been found online. The exposed server contained over 419 million records over several databases on users across geographies, including 133 million records on U.S.

title: EU looking to see if Facebook's Libra currency poses competition risks
text: EU regulators are examining Facebook's  proposed Libra cryptocurrency to see if it harms competition, Europe's antitrust regulator said on Wednesday, the latest watchdog to voice concerns about the social network's move into financial services.

title: Facebook to redirect anti-vaccine searches to public health pages
text: Facebook moves to stem spread of misinformation online about side-effects of immunisations

title: Facebook stops automatic facial recognition to tag photos
text: Facebook has announced it will no longer use facial recognition technology to automatically tag people in photos unless the user has opted in.
